business.headline: Cipla CEO Umang Vohra to exit in 2026; COO Achin Gupta named successorThe company said Achin Gupta, currently Cipla's Global Chief Operating Officer (COO), will take over as CEO and MD from April 1, 2026.

Novo Nordisk starts bidding war with Pfizer over US biotech MetseraNovo Nordisk bid up to $8.5 billion, including $6 billion upfront and later milestone payments. Pfizer's bid was worth $7.3 billion including milestones.
Sensex closes 593 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 592.67 points to close at 84,404.46, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 176.05 points to end at 25,877.85.

The sons in Tata Sons: A legacy forged in destiny by adoptionFor two centuries, the Tata name has symbolised Indian industry and philanthropy. But who exactly are Tata Sons? Who are the heirs to the empire founded by Jamsetji Tata? This is where the saga began.

Elon Musk's Starlink kicks off demo runs in Mumbai ahead of India launchDuring the trial, Starlink is expected to demonstrate how its technology can deliver fast and reliable internet, even in remote areas where traditional broadband services are often unavailable.

Groww IPO details out. Check price band, GMP, and important datesGroww IPO consists of a fresh issue of 10.60 crore shares worth Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 55.72 crore shares amounting to Rs 5,572.30 crore.

Lenskart solutions IPO opens on October 31: Should you subscribe or wait?The much-awaited initial public offering (IPO) of Lenskart Solutions will open for subscription on October 31. As India's leading eyewear brand hits the primary market, investors are weighing if now is the right time to take a position.

End of big workforces? What Amazon's mass layoff really signalsAmazon's mass layoffs aren't about cutting costs; they signal a shift in how work is organised. AI is taking over tasks, but the real battle is about how companies value people.

Why India's IPO boom isn't always a sign of growth. Explains expertIndia's IPO market may be buzzing with record fundraising and investor enthusiasm, yet experts say much of the money raised isn't going into new projects or job creation.

UPS to cut 48,000 jobs this year amid major turnaround pushShares of the Atlanta-based delivery giant rose more than 7% in afternoon trading on Tuesday after it reported better-than-expected earnings and revenue.

ITR deadline for audit cases extended till December 10. Who benefits and what nextTaxpayers requiring audit reports have got more time this year — the CBDT has extended the ITR filing due date to December 10, 2025.

Russian oil taps turned off. What it means for Indian refinersIndia's cheap Russian oil phase is fading as sanctions tighten. Refiners are shifting to costlier US and Middle Eastern grades, raising import costs and likely putting eventual pressure on fuel prices.

Sensex, Nifty fall despite US Fed rate cut; all eyes on Trump-Xi meetingThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 251.52 points to 84,745.61 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 81.55 points to 25,972.35. Broader market indices also edged lower in early trade, tracking a mix of caution and profit booking.

This Sebi proposal may benefit your mutual fund investmentIn its consultation paper released on Tuesday, Sebi said the goal is to ensure that investors benefit more directly from the growing size of India's mutual fund industry. Sebi has invited public comments on the proposal until November 17.

Gold, silver rate today: Has US Fed rate cut impacted precious metal prices?Spot gold was up 0.4% at $3,942.97 per ounce. However, US gold futures for December delivery slipped 1.1% to $3,955 per ounce, indicating some profit booking after the recent gains.

US Fed rate cut by 25 bps: How will it impact Sensex, Nifty today?According to early trends, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 26,188 points as of 7:45 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open above Wednesday's closing level of 26,053.9.

Gold and silver prices recover from recent lows. Is it time to buy?After slipping to three-week lows earlier this week, gold and silver have regained some shine ahead of the US Fed's policy decision. As markets anticipate a possible rate cut, traders are now weighing whether this rebound marks a good buying opportunity.

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to reach USD 5 trillion market valueThe milestone, reached just three months after Nvidia crossed USD 4 trillion, now surpasses the entire cryptocurrency market's value and equals nearly half of Europe's benchmark Stoxx 600 index.

Significant progress made in India-EU trade talks: Piyush Goyal after key meetsThe minister said that both sides are working towards a fair and reputable trade agreement, which will benefit businesses and consumers in India and the EU alike.

boAt's parent Imagine Marketing refiles for Rs 15-billion IPO after 2022 delayTwo years after postponing its IPO plans, boAt's parent company Imagine Marketing is back in the game, filing fresh documents for a Rs 15-billion public issue.

entertainment.headline: Sweta Keswani: Priyanka Chopra only helping herself, not elevating South Asians In an exclusive interview with India Today, actor Sweta Keswani discussed how Priyanka Chopra is not helping elevate South Asians. She said that the global icon is only helping herself.

Enrique Iglesias waves from car window at star-struck fan amid Mumbai traffic Spanish singer and songwriter Enrique Iglesias waved at and acknowledged a fan amid Mumbai traffic. He is currently in India for his Mumbai concert.

Zubeen Garg's handwritten note goes viral before final film Roi Roi Binale release Singer Zubeen Garg's handwritten note has gone viral before the release of his final film 'Roi Roi Binale'. The beloved actor-singer had written the touching note before he left for Singapore.

Akshay Kumar celebrates niece Simar Bhatia's debut in Sriram Raghavan's Ikkis Actor Akshay Kumar publicly expressed pride for his niece Simar Bhatia as she debuted in the film 'Ikkis', directed by Sriram Raghavan, extending his wishes to the cast and crew.

SRK on whether he'll work in film with Aryan: If he can afford me and my tantrums Shah Rukh Khan opened up on being directed by his son Aryan Khan during his live session on X. A social media user asked the actor whether he would be seen in a full-fledged movie directed by Aryan.

Can Mass Jathara reignite Ravi Teja's spark as Telugu cinema's people's hero? Once celebrated as Telugu cinema's unstoppable mass hero, Ravi Teja now stands at a crossroads. After a streak of underwhelming films, 'Mass Jathara' isn't just another release — it's a make-or-break moment to see if the actor who built his legacy on energy and relatability can reclaim his spark.

EXO's OT9 comeback? CBX accepts all conditions of SM Entertainment EXO's CBX trio signals readiness to reunite for full-group activities after months of silence. The ongoing legal disputes with SM Entertainment continue to cloud the possibility of a complete comeback.

Shah Rukh Khan fan asks for room at Mannat. Read the superstar's witty reply Shah Rukh Khan gave a witty reply to a fan asking for room in Mannat. The actor replied to the fan's question during his live interactive session on X.

BB19 producer denies minimum guarantee for contestants, breaks down casting process In an exclusive interaction with India Today, 'Bigg Boss 19' producer Rishi Negi cleared the air about the minimum guarantee contracts for the contestants. The producer even spoke about the casting process.

Sadhguru asks why handsome Yash is playing Ravana in Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana Spiritual leader Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev expressed surprise over actor Yash being cast as Ravana in 'Ramayana'. The discussion highlighted casting challenges and differing views on the villain portrayal.

Bharti Singh wants baby girl, dreams of dressing her up like Deepika-Ranveer's Dua Bharti Singh, who is expecting her second child, said she wishes for a baby girl and hopes to dress her up like Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh's daughter Dua. The comedian shared her excitement after seeing her baby's colour sonography, calling the little one "so, so gorgeous."

Halloween high: 7 Indian horror icons scarier than your Monday meetings From Manjulika to Stree, here are seven Indian horror characters guaranteed to make your Halloween scream-worthy and nights sleepless. Happy Halloween on October 31!

RM at APEC: Why BTS leader's speech signals a new era of Asian Cultural Power BTS leader RM made history by speaking at the APEC CEO Summit in 2025. His address highlighted culture as a key economic and diplomatic force shaping Asia-Pacific's future.

Baramulla trailer: Manav Kaul faces haunting case of missing children in Kashmir The trailer for Manav Kaul and Bhasha Sumbli's supernatural-thriller, 'Baramulla', was recently released. The film is based on the mystery about missing children in the Kashmir valley.

Late Pankaj Dheer's daughter-in-law Kratika Sengar recalls bond in touching post Remembering late actor Pankaj Dheer fondly, his daughter-in-law Kratika Sengar shared a heartfelt tribute on Instagram on Thursday. The veteran actor died on October 15.

Yash's Toxic team dismisses delay rumours, re-confirms March 2026 release The makers of 'Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups' have confirmed that the highly anticipated film starring Yash remains on schedule for its global theatrical release on March 19, 2026, addressing and dismissing recent speculation about a possible postponement.

Sonakshi Sinha says she's accidental actor, credits Salman and Arbaaz for her debut Sonakshi Sinha shared that she never planned to become an actor and called herself an accidental actor. She credited Salman and Arbaaz Khan for recognising her potential and giving her the opportunity to begin her journey in Bollywood with 'Dabangg'.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 52: Bharani injured, Thanuja–Madhuri clash heats up Day 52 of 'Bigg Boss Telugu Season 9' brought a perfect mix of emotion, strategy, and chaos. From Bharani's injury during a tough task to the fiery kitchen fight between Thanuja and Madhuri, the episode proved to be one of the season's most dramatic yet.

Jonita Gandhi on working with Ed Sheeran, power of Indian folk, and viral reel era Bollywood singer Jonita Gandhi has teamed up with global icon Ed Sheeran for his latest album 'Play' and their single 'Heaven'. In an interview with us, she highlighted the rising global love for Indian music and the unmatched thrill of live performances.

general news.headline: Mumbai hostage taker dies of bullet injury, was shot during children's rescueAuthorities earlier said that the suspect, who was an employee of RA Studio, was detained following the successful rescue of the children.

35 minutes, 8 commandos: Inside Mumbai's dramatic studio hostage rescueThe operation was carried out in just 35 minutes. A Quick Reaction Team (QRT) of eight commandos barged into the audition room through a bathroom, a small entry point chosen to preserve surprise and prevent hostages from being exposed at the main entrance.

US changes work-permit rules overnight; students, spouses of H-1B holders to be hitThe Trump Administration has ended automatic extensions of certain Employment Authorisation Documents (EADs) from October 30, affecting H-4 visa holders, F-1 students on OPT, and asylum seekers. Applicants must now undergo fresh vetting to get their work permit renewed. The overnight change disproportionately impacts Indian workers.

You sold a dream; how can you stop us? Indian-origin woman confronts JD VanceThe US Vice President was also asked by the woman about his Hindu wife and their 'inter-cultural' household in the face of the Trump administration's strict immigration policies.

Blood, pile of corpses from Sudan massacre visible from spaceA humanitarian crisis has been unfolding in Sudan that the world has shut its eyes to. Such is the scale of the killings in El Fasher city in North Darfur captured from by militia Rapid Support Forces that the blood and the pile of bodies are visible from space.

IND vs AUS semfinal live: Mandhana leads India's chase India (IND) vs Australia (AUS) Live Score, Women's World Cup 2nd semi-final: Smriti Mandhana and Jemimah Rodrigues have kept India's chase on track with their brilliant partnership. Earlier, India lost the big wicket of Shafali Verma, chasing 339. The right-handed batter got dismissed lbw for 10 on her ODI comeback after almost a year.

Justice Surya Kant appointed 53rd Chief Justice of India, to take charge on Nov 24The appointment was announced by Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal, who congratulated him on X. Justice Kant, a former Chief Justice of the Himachal Pradesh High Court, is known for his judgments on governance, social justice, and constitutional law.

Who was Rohit Arya, man who held children hostage in Mumbai's Powai studio?Rohit Arya, the man who held children hostage in a studio in Powai, died of a bullet injury after being shot during a stand-off with cops at Powai studio.

JD Vance hopes wife Usha, a Hindu, will eventually embrace ChristianityIt was wife Usha Vance, a Hindu, who helped an agnostic JD Vance, now the US Vice-President, find Christian faith. JD Vance has now said that he hopes Usha, who accompanies him to church most Sundays, would, eventually, see the Christian gospel like he does.

3 trials, over Rs 1 crore bill, zero rain. The cost of cloud seedingDelhi rain: The Delhi government, in collaboration with IIT Kanpur, has conducted three cloud seeding trials to date, with none producing any significant rain in the capital. Is spending crores for just a drizzle worth it?

Unpaid dues, credit denied: What triggered Rohit Arya's Mumbai hostage dramaRohit Arya, who held children hostage in Mumbai's Powai, was reportedly frustrated over unpaid dues and denial of credit for his school project. The activist's long-standing dispute with Maharashtra education officials allegedly pushed him to the desperate act that ended in his death.

CBSE board exam 2026 final datesheet out for Class 10, 12. Check hereThe CBSE board exam 2026 final datesheet has been released for Classes 10 and 12. The exams will be held from February 17 to April 10.

US drones, not India, real reason why Pak-Afghan peace talks crashedPakistan Defence Minister Khwaja Asif blamed India after the peace talks with Taliban-ruled Afghanistan failed. Though Islamabad might use that as the ruse, the real reason behind the crashing of the talks, which were initiated after a recent war got hundreds killed, is Pakistan's helplessness at preventing US drones from attacks inside Afghanistan.

Video: Bengaluru couple chases delivery agent for brushing against car, kills himInitially registered as an accident, the case turned into a murder probe when CCTV footage showed the car deliberately following and hitting the victims. The couple has been taken into custody.

I'm not a terrorist nor do I seek ransom: Chilling video of Mumbai hostage takerA tense situation unfolded in Mumbai where 17 children and two adults were taken hostage at a studio in Powai. The hostage taker released a video message, in which he said he wanted to talk to "certain people" or the children would be harmed.

Mahagathbandhan readies for Bihar polls, but Congress seen as weak linkThe Mahagathbandhan alliance, including RJD, Congress, VIP, and left parties, faces internal challenges ahead of the Bihar assembly polls, with Congress viewed as the fragile point in the coalition.

The sons in Tata Sons: A legacy forged in destiny by adoptionFor two centuries, the Tata name has symbolised Indian industry and philanthropy. But who exactly are Tata Sons? Who are the heirs to the empire founded by Jamsetji Tata? This is where the saga began.

BJP asks poll body to act against Rahul Gandhi over 'PM will dance' remarkMissing in action for weeks amid speculation of a discord with Mahagathandhan allies, Rahul Gandhi kicked off his campaign in Bihar on Wednesday with a barrage of personal attacks targeting PM Modi.

Grieving Bengaluru father shares bribery ordeal after daughter's deathSivakumar K, former Chief Financial Officer of Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL), detailed his ordeal in a now-deleted LinkedIn post, sparking widespread outrage over corruption in the city.

China brings law to regulate influencers: Only experts can give expert adviceChina has made it a must for social media influencers creating content on "serious topics", such as medicine, law, finance, and education, to have degrees or expertise in those areas. The move is aimed at curbing misinformation on the internet. Violators would face a fine of up to $14,000.

'Something truly unique': World's first-ever white Iberian Lynx spotted in SpainThe Lynx is considered a mythical creature by the locals. The mythical status stems from the fact that most Lynx are either brown or beige-white.

University staff force women to show period proof, photograph pads for evidenceWomen sanitation workers at Rohtak's Maharshi Dayanand University alleged that their supervisors asked them to send photos of their sanitary pads to prove they were menstruating.

Adulting is hard, but it's harder when your parents are fightingWatching your parents fight as an adult can feel deeply unsettling. You feel helpless, full of thoughts and emotions, yet unable to say or do much. And even if you don't show it, the emotional weight of those moments can be heavy.

Officers forced entry via bathroom, airgun at site: Cops detail Mumbai hostage rescueMumbai Police rescued 17 children and a senior citizen after forcing entry through a bathroom into an acting studio in Powai, where a man had taken them hostage. The suspect, identified as Rohit Arya, was shot during the operation and later died in hospital.

sports.headline: Martinez returns to Manchester United 1st team training after lengthy layoff Lisandro Martinez has resumed full first-team training with Manchester United after recovering from a serious ACL injury suffered in February. The defender took part in a first-team session at Carrington, marking his first appearance since his surgery eight months ago.

Tanush Kotian credits Mumbai's experienced stars for improved showing for India A Tanush Kotian reflects on his growth as an off-spinner through guidance from senior players and coaches, following a strong bowling display against South Africa A.

Shafali Verma's dramatic ODI comeback ends in heartbreak against Australia Women's World Cup, IND vs AUS: Shafali Verma managed just 10 runs off five balls in the semi-final before being dismissed LBW by Kim Garth. The match marked Shafali's ODI comeback after a year out of the squad.

Rahul Dravid recalls mother's reaction to viral Indiranagar ka gunda advertisement Rahul Dravid opened up about his viral 'Indiranagar ka gunda' advertisement and initial doubts. Dravid's bat-wielding, road-rage persona became a huge hit and the ad went viral on social media in 2021.

Litchfield hundred powers Australia to highest World Cup semi-final score Australia posted the highest score in Women's World Cup semi-finals history on the back of Phoebe Litchfield's stunning hundred on Thursday, October 30. Australia posted 338 runs in 49.5 overs against India.

Bengaluru FC coach questions Khalid Jamil on using Sunil Chhetri as a lone striker Bengaluru FC head coach Gerard Zaragoza criticised India's use of Sunil Chhetri after the team's Asian Cup exit, raising concerns about his positioning and effectiveness.

Mumbai Indians rubbish rumours of Rohit Sharma's move to Kolkata Knight Riders Mumbai Indians have dismissed rumours of Rohit Sharma's trade to Kolkata Knight Riders ahead of IPL 2026. The franchise quipped on X that such a move is "not just difficult, but impossible," reaffirming their faith in the five-time title-winning star.

Rohit Sharma deserves credit for changing India's white-ball mindset: Rahul Dravid Former India coach Rahul Dravid has credited Rohit Sharma for changing the way the national team started playing white-ball cricket. Dravid and Rohit masterminded India's T20 World Cup 2024 win.

Beta version of Travis Head: Phoebe Litchfield stuns India fans with century in semis Phoebe Litchfield's dazzling Women's World Cup semi-final century mirrored Travis Head's 2023 final heroics, as both Aussies delivered the stupendous knocks with flair and precision on cricket's grandest stage.

PKL Season 12 final: Dabang Delhi vs Puneri Paltan all you need to know Dabang Delhi K.C. and Puneri Paltan will face each other in the PKL Season 12 final at the Thyagaraj Indoor Stadium, New Delhi. Both teams have displayed dominance throughout the league and each of their three meetings this season have gone into a tiebreaker.

Mitchell Starc arrives in Navi Mumbai to support Alyssa Healy for AUS vs IND semi-final Mitchell Starc's presence in the stands wasn't enough to inspire wife Alyssa Healy, who fell for just 5 in Australia's semi-final clash against India. The Aussie skipper's early dismissal gave India a strong start.

Mumbai Indians rubbish rumours of Rohit Sharma's move to Kolkata Knight Riders Mumbai Indians have dismissed rumours of Rohit Sharma's trade to Kolkata Knight Riders ahead of IPL 2026. The franchise quipped on X that such a move is "not just difficult, but impossible," reaffirming their faith in the five-time title-winning star.

PKL Season 12 final: Dabang Delhi vs Puneri Paltan all you need to know Dabang Delhi K.C. and Puneri Paltan will face each other in the PKL Season 12 final at the Thyagaraj Indoor Stadium, New Delhi. Both teams have displayed dominance throughout the league and each of their three meetings this season have gone into a tiebreaker.

Mitchell Starc arrives in Navi Mumbai to support Alyssa Healy for AUS vs IND semi-final Mitchell Starc's presence in the stands wasn't enough to inspire wife Alyssa Healy, who fell for just 5 in Australia's semi-final clash against India. The Aussie skipper's early dismissal gave India a strong start.

IPL 2026: Abhishek Nayar becomes new Kolkata Knight Riders head coachKolkata Knight Riders have confirmed that Abhishek Nayar has been appointed as the new head coach of the franchise ahead of the IPL 2026 season.

Suryakumar Yadav is India's best option at number 3 vs Australia: Robin UthappaRobin Uthappa believes Suryakumar Yadav should bat at No. 3 in India's T20I lineup to regain form and stability. The former India batter feels consistency in position will unlock his true potential.

Australia, India players wear black armbands to mourn 17-year-old cricketer's deathThe Indian and Australian players were seen wearing black armbands to mourn the death of 17-year-old Ben Austin. The young talent died after being hit on the neck area in the nets on Tuesday.

Why Guwahati Test will have tea before lunch break in historic firstSouth Africa tour of India: The order of lunch and tea breaks will be reversed when Guwhati hosts a men's Test for the first time in history. India will host South Africa at Barsapara Stadium from November 22.

India make three changes, Alyssa Healy returns for AustraliaWomen's World Cup: Australia captain Alyssa Healy returned for the all-important semi-final, while India made three changes, bringing back Richa Ghosh, Shafali Verma and Kranti Goud for the knockout clash in Navi Mumbai.

Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca slams Liam Delap for rash red-card vs Wolves: EmbarrasingLiam Delap's rash red-card on his injury return soured Chelsea's 4-3 Carabao Cup win over Wolves, as Enzo Maresca blasted the striker for being "selfish" and "embarrassing."

Marizanne Kapp eager to face India in ICC Women's World Cup 2025 finalSouth Africa thrashed England by 125 runs in the 2nd semi-final to reach the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 final. Marizanne Kapp said she would love to face India in the final, mentioning the excitement of playing in front of packed Indian crowds.

India make three changes, Alyssa Healy returns for AustraliaWomen's World Cup: Australia captain Alyssa Healy returned for the all-important semi-final, while India made three changes, bringing back Richa Ghosh, Shafali Verma and Kranti Goud for the knockout clash in Navi Mumbai.

Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca slams Liam Delap for rash red-card vs Wolves: EmbarrasingLiam Delap's rash red-card on his injury return soured Chelsea's 4-3 Carabao Cup win over Wolves, as Enzo Maresca blasted the striker for being "selfish" and "embarrassing."

Marizanne Kapp eager to face India in ICC Women's World Cup 2025 finalSouth Africa thrashed England by 125 runs in the 2nd semi-final to reach the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 final. Marizanne Kapp said she would love to face India in the final, mentioning the excitement of playing in front of packed Indian crowds.

Canadian Open Squash: Anahat Singh's dream run ends in semifinalsIndia's Anahat Singh's impressive run at the Canadian Women's Open ended in the semifinals with a straight-games defeat to England's Georgina Kennedy, following upset wins over two higher-ranked opponents.

IND vs AUS semfinal live: Mandhana leads India's chase India (IND) vs Australia (AUS) Live Score, Women's World Cup 2nd semi-final: Smriti Mandhana and Jemimah Rodrigues have kept India's chase on track with their brilliant partnership. Earlier, India lost the big wicket of Shafali Verma, chasing 339. The right-handed batter got dismissed lbw for 10 on her ODI comeback after almost a year.

Can Harmanpreet Kaur awaken sleeping beast against old foes Australia?As India prepare to take on Australia in the second semi-final of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025, all eyes will be on captain Harmanpreet Kaur, who will be expected to awaken the sleeping beast inside of her and take her team closer to the World Cup glory.

Sanju Samson is India's unluckiest player in India: Srikkanth on his T20I roleKris Srikkanth has called Sanju Samson the unluckiest player in Indian cricket, criticising the team's constant changes to his batting order. The former selector believes such instability has dented Samson's confidence despite his proven potential.

Rishabh Pant wears Virat Kohli's No. 18 jersey on return to competitive actionRishabh Pant marked his return from a three-month injury layoff by wearing Virat Kohli's iconic No. 18 jersey for India A. The choice of jersey sparked debate on social media, with fans discussing Kohli's legacy and whether his number should have been retired.

Teenage Australian cricketer dies after being struck in the neck by a ballAustralian cricket was left in shock on Thursday following the death of a teenage player who was struck by a ball during training at his Melbourne club. Ben Austin, 17, was hit high on the neck by a delivery from a teammate while batting in the nets at Ferntree Gully Cricket Club on Tuesday, Cricket Victoria (CV) said in a statement.

Sai Sudharsan shares Gautam Gambhir's advice that ended his run-drought: You will playSai Sudharsan has opened up about Gautam Gambhir's reassuring message that helped him overcome a lean patch. The young India batter says the chat changed his mindset and restored his confidence at the crease.

Getting better: Shreyas Iyer's first message after spleen injury horrorIndia's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer has shared a positive update on his recovery after suffering a rib injury during the third ODI against Australia in Sydney. The 29-year-old batter, who was admitted to intensive care following the incident, took to social media to thank fans for their messages and assured that he is making steady progress.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
